channel.title: Cache-downloading (webclient)
channel.description:
Hi all. Just recently I have written a simple html file to load a webclient. This is the code used in the file.
[code=of my html file]<body> <body bgcolor="000000"> <center> <applet name="Client" width="505" height="345" archive="XPK.jar" code="com.demonik.client.mudclient.class"> </applet> </center> </body>[/code]
Then, this: [img]http://i45.tinypic.com/fkuwqf.png[/img]
Help on how to fix that? Thanks in advance. ;)

oh and office ain’t you the one whos must rejected on mopar seeing you flaming on rsce topic people pretty must hate you already.

I’m not liked because I don’t sugar-coat anything, and I will throw anything in your face if you put it to the table, hence my name. I’m not a “reject”, I’m an asshole. Google the definition, because surely you don’t know the difference between the two.

You on the other hand, are purely retarded - I’ve been watching and studying you: You’re a complete moron. Lets take that one server for example, where you claimed someone faked how many users were online, because some text went over the UI, and after being proved wrong, you kept going like an idiot. I laughed so hard at that.

If you want to keep going, lets do this some where else, because this is irrelevant.

item.title: Cache-downloading (webclient)
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

The client has flagged this because one or more of your data files (models / sounds) did not run through the unpacker correctly. To determine which file it is, you can add comments in your client’s body.

Example:

protected final byte[] load(String fileName) {
	if(!(new java.io.File(fileName).exists())) {
		java.lang.StringBuffer buffer = new java.lang.StringBuffer();
		buffer.append("Error loading file: ");
		buffer.append(fileName);
		buffer.append(" ensure valid path and file name.");
		System.out.println(buffer.toString());
		buffer.setLength(0);
		/*
		StringBuffer is MUCH less expensive to the processor than the simple += concat operations.
		*/
	}
}

As for a solution to your problem, I’m not very good at web-based application, but have you tried dropping these files in the same directory as your codebase?

Read full topic
